title: Associations between cerebral blood transit time, amyloid-β pathology and cognitive decline in non-demented older adults.
abstract: The contribution of cerebrovascular hemodynamic disturbances to Alzheimer's disease (AD) remains unclear. Using time-shift analysis of blood-oxygenation-level-dependent (BOLD) signals, we explored associations between cerebral blood transit time, amyloid beta (Aβ) pathology, and cognition. We included 131 non-demented individuals from the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative.
